dashboard.name: Workload Status & Performance

advancedQueries.query:
(
  sum by(kube_cluster_name,kube_namespace_name,kube_workload_name)(kube_workload_status_desired{cluster=~$cluster,namespace=~$namespace,kube_workload_name=~$workload,kube_workload_type=~$type})
)
-
(
  sum by(kube_cluster_name,kube_namespace_name,kube_workload_name)(kube_workload_status_ready{cluster=~$cluster,namespace=~$namespace,kube_workload_name=~$workload,kube_workload_type=~$type, kube_workload_type!="daemonset"} or kube_daemonset_status_number_ready{cluster=~$cluster,namespace=~$namespace,kube_workload_name=~$workload}) or vector(0)
)
 > 0 or vector(0)

panels.name: Pod health info
panels.markdownSource:
‚õ≥Ô∏è A pod will be in the **Not Available** state or have **too many restarts** for several reasons:

‚úÖ Check if the rest of the pods in the deployment are also unavailable.
- This specific case indicates a problem with the resource quota of the namespace or the capacity of the nodes.
  * üëâ See the **[Cluster Capacity](#/dashboard-template/view.kubernetes.cluster.capacityPlanning)** dashboard to check if both cluster and namespace have enough resources to allocate to the pods.
  * üëâ If the namespace and the nodes have sufficient resources, the problem could be related to the runtime of one of the pod's containers. See the **[Pod Overview](#/dashboard-template/view.kubernetes.pod.status)** dashboard to identify the problems in the pod's containers.

- Ensure that all the containers in the deployment are using the same image.
  * üëâ See the **Images by Deployment** section below.

‚úÖ Check if the rest of the pods in the deployment are also unavailable. If this is the case, it could be a configuration or container issue.
*  üëâ See the **[Pod Overview](#/dashboard-template/view.kubernetes.pod.status)** dashboard to identify the problems in the pod's containers.


‚úÖ Check if the problematic pod was in any of the following states to narrow down the potential issue:
- The percentage of pod available is not 100%
- The desired pods are not the same as the pods ready
- The number of pods in the pods not ready status is more than 0
- The number of pods status unknown is more than 0

**‚≠êÔ∏èTip**:  To locate the deployment with these potential problems, filter by cluster and namespace and check the **Pods available** status.

panels.name: ‚ôªÔ∏è Pod Restarts
panels.nullValueDisplayText: No pods restarted on the selected workloads

panels.name: Percentage of CPU limit per Workload
Percentage of Memory limit per Workload
New Panel (5)
panels.markdownSource: ‚úÖ Check for  unexpected low or high request rate. Itmight mean a malfunction in this or other systems or an attack.

panels.name: New Panel (6)
panels.markdownSource: ‚úÖ Latency should be below your SLO. Check for resource constrains in **[Pod Overview](#/dashboard-template/view.kubernetes.pod.status)**

panels.name: New Panel (7)
panels.markdownSource: ‚úÖ Error count should be as low as possible. Check for resource constrains in **[Pod Overview](#/dashboard-template/view.kubernetes.pod.status)**

panels.name: New Panel (8)
panels.markdownSource: ‚ö†Ô∏è Check traffic and connections to your apps.

panels.name: New Panel (9)
panels.markdownSource: ‚úÖ Latency should be below your SLO. Check for workload issues in **[Workload state](#/dashboard-template/view.kubernetes.workload.status)**

panels.name: New Panel (10)
panels.markdownSource: ‚úÖ Error rate should be below your SLO. Check for resource constrains in **[Pod Overview](#/dashboard-template/view.kubernetes.pod.status)**

panels.name: Containers Waiting By Reason
panels.description: Possible reasons:  ContainerCreating, CrashLoopBackOff, CreateContainerConfigError, ErrImagePull, ImagePullBackOff, CreateContainerError, InvalidImageName
panels.nullValueDisplayText: No containers in waiting state on the selected workloads

panels.name: Pods Not Ready By Reason
panels.nullValueDisplayText: No containers in not ready state on the selected workloads

panels.name: Container Uncontrolled Terminated By Reason
panels.description: Possible reasons: OOMKilled, Error, ContainerCannotRun, DeadlineExceeded
panels.nullValueDisplayText: No pods terminated in a non controlled way on the selected workloads

dashboard.description: Understand the status of applications (workloads) running in a cluster by monitoring status, health, resource usage and performance.
